fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

[Rich Text Gadget for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214632/rich-text-gadget-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=support]not working in wallboard mode

As the Confluence Page Gadget was deprecated, the Rich Text Gadget for Jira became an alternative to accomplish the same task.

Issue 1: Rich Text Gadget does not display in Wallboard mode
Issue 2 - Rich Text Gadget requires a URL to display an image rather than what seemed to be the standard Atlassian upload-image flow & UI.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create dashboard
 # Add Rich Text Gadget for Jira (Installed by default in Jira Cloud)
 !AsDashboard.jpg|thumbnail!
 # View as wallboard

h3. Expected Results
 * For it to display Rich Text on the wallboard

h3. Actual Results
 * Nothing is displayed when viewing wallboard
 !ViewAsWallboard.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
 * App is part of Atlassian Labs which isn't offical supported. For more information please see Atlassian Community post [here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/tag/addon-rich-text-gadget/tg-p/category-id/atlassian-marketplace?_ga=2.46582753.736032339.1545811219-936811704.1543969192]

h3. Workaround
 * None
fields.summary: Rich Text Gadget Improvment

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a group name containing special characters such as 'Ö', is granted with project permissions, the granted permissions to the group are being ignored.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a group and include some special character in the name such as Ö or İ (i.e. ABCÖDEİ)
# Grant this group with Browse Projects permission in a project
# Add a user to this group
# Login as the user and try to access project's issues (i.e. through issue navigator)

h3. Expected Results
* User can access project as he/she is a member of a group which is granted Browse Project permission

h3. Actual Results
* User is unable to access the project and its issues

h3. Workarounds
* Add a project without any special characters and use it as replacement of the group with special characters
* Grant the users directly with the project permissions in the permission scheme
fields.summary: Project permissions are being ignored when group name contains special characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When performing a bulk operation (bulk edit for example), on step 3 the admin can choose to send or not to send an email regarding that change.
Currently, if you opt to send an email, it will send 2 notifications. On the other hand, if you choose to NOT send an email, it will send a single notification anyway.

h3. Environment
Jira cdad30f3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# go to issue navigator and make a query
# click bulk change
# select some issues and click Next
# select Edit issues and click Next
# edit any field and unmark the box "Send mail for this update"

h3. Expected Results
There should be no notification

h3. Actual Results
The users involved (assignee, reporter, watcher, according to the Notification scheme) will receive a notification.

h3. Notes
Alternatively, if on step 5 you have marked the box "Send mail for this update", the notification will be duplicated.

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Jira bulk change is firing the notification event even if the admin select to NOT send

The comment should be added to the issue

The comment is not added to the issue

None so far.

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

When a user creates post-function it is automatically added at the top of the order, especially for issue creation post-function. Therefore, when the issue is actually being created, the issue cannot be processed as it goes through the post-function and attempts to launch the orders(screenshot provided) based on the list and the *Create the issue originally* is supposed to be the first always in order for the issue to be properly created. This causes additional issues, when let's say the first order is a custom field which is deleted, the creation of the issue fails because it does not detect the custom field to be updated anymore and thus does not move on to the next transition order.
h3. *Suggested Solution*
 * When a post-function is created, it should be ordered below the *Create the issue originally* to avoid any complication when changes are made.
 * Additionally, to have a warning that mentions that when cloning or deleting a custom field that it will not be possible to do so due to the ordering of the post function.

h3. *Sample Picture*

  !order.png|width=1301,height=238!
h3. *Why this is important*

The create issue post-functions affects a lot of other functions such as cloning issue and deletion of custom fields in the project, there are post-functions being run before the "*create issue originally*" post-function which breaks a lot of things.Therefore in orde
fields.summary: When creating a new post-function for Create Transition Ensure It is Ordered after "Create the Issue Originally"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira Chart (such as Workload Pie Chart) does not render multibyte characters correctly.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud
 * Confluence Cloud - when embedding the chart as a macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add "Workload Pie Chart" to an arbitrary dashboard
 # Confirm the estimation hours are correctly rendered such as "2h"
 # Change your browser language to any non-ASCII language such as "Japanese"
 # Confirm the estimation hours are incorrectly rendered such as "2□□"
 ** !Screenshot_2017-11-07_16_18_06.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The multibyte characters are correctly rendered.
h3. Actual Results

The multibyte characters get garbled.
h3. Notes
 * This is possibly due to missing language packs and/or the lack of font files installed on the server side

h3. Workaround
 * Consider going with a Pie Chart on Dashboards instead. It looks like an image below:

!スクリーンショット 2019-10-29 17.28.58.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Jira Charting Plugin does not render multi-byte characters correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

At times, when you load issue navigator with a filter at the end of the query, the inline editing stopped working and the edit icon stuck on the label icon.

Similarly, the drop down field's operation is not available (g + g). Note: the administrative drop down still available

Eg, sample query:
 * [https://sample.atlassian.net/TEST-123?filter=-1]

(!) The above sample appended filter id as *-1*, however it affects other id as well. -1 is a system filter which can be used to easily replicate this issue.

h3. How to Replicate 

This only affects the issue navigator list view, not affecting detail view

# Navigate to issue navigator, switch to list view
# Click on one of the issue

*OR*

# Browse an issue - https://<URL>/browse/<ISSUE-KEY> 
# Append the filter (Eg, filter=-1) at the end of the URL

h3. Expected Results 

The issue loads fine with all the functional intact

h3. Actual Results. 

The issue seems to be lacking a few features to be loaded successfully. Noticeably:
* Inline Editing
* Field Operation Drop down Menu 
  
h3. Workaround 

* Remove the filter query should return back to all working state
* Switch to detail view for the mean time

h3. More information

From the browser's developer tool console, you should be able to see error message as such:
{noformat}
JIRA.API.Projects: project-id is undefined
{noformat}
This indicates that there are some error occurred which prevented the further feature from being loading.
fields.summary: Filter URLs Causing Inline Editing Not Working

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there isn't a feature that allows admins to export/import "Fix Version/s"("Releases") in Jira Software projects.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Implement import/Export feature on the "Fix Version/s" configuration page ("Releases") within Jira Software projects
* Allow "Fix Version/s values to be copied along with the Jira issues when performing a bulk change

h3. Why this is important
* Saves admins time when moving Jira issues/tasks from one project to another(bulk operations)
* Potential for discrepancies in the "Fix Version/s" field when moving Jira issues/tasks from one project to another
 
h3. Workaround 
* Manually recreate the "Fix Version/s" in the project settings - ensure that all attributes of each version are identical to the "source" or original "Fix Version/s" values.
fields.summary: Allow "Releases"/"Versions"/"Fix Version/s" to be exported/imported into projects

Caused by: com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.LicenceExceededException: {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"400","detail":"Unable to create the user as you have insufficient licence seats for Jira Software","errorType":"LicenceExceeded","message":"Unable to create the user as you have insufficient licence seats for Jira Software","data":"Jira Software"}

This occurs when the customer is on a fixed-seat license and they try to import more users than they have seats for. The easiest workaround is to remove inactive users from the import file. (their <User> xml element will have {{active="0"}} in that line - just delete the line. If it still fails then more users will have to be deleted. 

This is really strange and shouldn't be happening so I think there might be a bug somewhere with how we clear out the old users - maybe we're doing it later than we should, or maybe we need to wait for IDP's eventual consistency to clear up before we start creating users.
fields.summary: Import fails because not all users can be created due to license exceeded

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It's not possible to search for parent issues where its sub-tasks are in a specific status.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a JQL function to check for child issues statuses

h3. Why this is important
Sometimes it's necessary to search for issues where its sub-tasks aren't completed and this is not possible at the moment. It returns all the sub-tasks and we cannot filter sub-tasks statuses.

h3. Workaround
N/AS
fields.summary: JQL to search for issues where its sub-tasks are in a specific status

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The default field *Priority* shows the list of possible values when creating/editing/viewing issues in Jira but doesn't help the user with a description to know which Priority is applicable for his case. PS: Necessary mainly if there is a newely created priority.
h3. Suggested Solution

How to handle this?
 * Providing the possibility to pop-up a description message when clicking on the select list *Priority* field and when scrolling down between the different suggested priorities.
 * This can be provided in the view issues screen and also in the create/edit issue screens for the default field *Priority*.

h3. Why this is important

We noticed that in the *view issues* screen it is possible to modify the priority between the different values (Priority 1, Priority 2, Priority 3 ...) but no information is given to show which value to choose. In case, the user may be worried that his colleagues/coworkers won't know when the newely created priority P4 can be selected, since they don't have enough information about it.

It would be helpful if the description of the priorities are shared with the user through a pop-up message for example.
h3. Workaround

Step1: Add a description to the Priority field: this will show the information related to all the priorities or a specific information about one priority. This description will appear when creating or editing an issue but will not appear through the *view issues* screen. 
 Step 2: Add a *custom field (Read Only)* giving details about the priorities or the newely created priority. This information will appear through the *view issues* screen only.
fields.summary: Show description of default Priorities or a newly customized prioritiy before choosing

User wants to create a filter to show for example issues that are open, with X version and all of those issues subtasks. 
Today, you can search for issues subtasks by specifying the issues "parent".

ex of JQL code: 

{code}
status = Open AND affectedVersion = <version> AND parent = <issue key OR Id>
{code}

So, the user wants to show all issues based on certain criteria and whatever subtasks these issues have, not specific issues subtasks (without having to specify the issues "parent").

A known current workaround is documented at [HowTo: Filter to show sub-tasks of a filtered list of parent tasks|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/HowTo%3A+Filter+to+show+sub+tasks+of+a+filtered+list+of+parent+tasks] .

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

Almost all the information present in the below documentation page for JIRA Server is missing for JIRA Cloud:
- JIRA Server page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/editing-a-project-key-935391076.html
- JIRA Cloud page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/editing-a-project-s-details-938021482.html

\\
Specifically the sections named *Notes for change management* and *Notes for developers* contain very useful information that should be available to Cloud users as well:

{quote}
*Notes for change management*

While editing the project key is a major change, in most cases, your JIRA project will work as you'd expect with a new key. There are a few cases that you should be aware of, which are listed below. We recommend reviewing these and advising your users accordingly.
- The old project key can be used in JQL queries — Users won't have to update issue filters that reference the old project key.
If you use Confluence with JIRA, the JIRA issue macros in Confluence will continue to work. Please note, if you don't see the change straight away, allow some time for the cache to refresh.
- You won't be able to create a new project with the old project key. However, you can change the renamed project back to the old project key. If you delete the project, all associated keys will be freed and you'll be able to re-use them.
- Links will work, whether they are inside JIRA or from external sources. However, link aliases will not be updated — For example, if you have a link to an issue 'EXAMPLE-1' in the description of an issue, and you change the project key 'EXAMPLE' to 'DEMO', then the alias 'EXAMPLE-1' will not be updated to 'DEMO-1'. The link will still direct you to DEMO-1 though.
- If you are using a gadget with a global filter, you will need to update the filter after the project is renamed.
- All attachments will be accessible after the project key change. Please note however, that the directory that they are stored in (under the <JIRA Home>\data\attachments directory) will be retain the old project key. For example, if you change a project's key from TEST to DEMO, the attachments will be stored under <JIRA Home>\data\attachments\TEST.
- If you export a renamed project, then import it, it will have the updated project key, i.e. the original project key will not be retained. In fact, all historical keys for that project will be removed. There is a workaround for this that involves changing data directly in your database, see [this Answers post|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/257060/renaming-and-importing-a-project-where-has-the-old-project-key-history-gone-redirects-search?page=1#257061].
{quote}

{quote}
*Notes for developers*

- REST API calls will still work with old project key — REST calls that specify an issue key will work with the old issue key after the project key has changed. For example, /rest/api/issue/EXAMPLE-100 will still work after the project key is changed from EXAMPLE to DEMO.
- We have created a new event, ProjectUpdatedEvent. This event is triggered any time a project's details are changed, including changing the project key.
- If you need to retrieve all issue keys and project keys (historical and current), you can do this via the following:
-* REST:
Get all project keys for a project: /rest/api/2/project/<project key>?expand=projectKeys
-* Java API:
-*- Get all project keys: com.atlassian.jira.project.ProjectManager#getAllProjectKeys
-*- Get all issue keys for an issue: com.atlassian.jira.issue.IssueManager#getAllIssueKeys
{quote}
fields.summary: The "Editing a project key" documentation page for JIRA Cloud misses the "Notes for change management" and "Notes for developers" sections that are available in the same page for JIRA Server

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users invited to use Confluence on a site get an email that sends them to Jira, where they cannot view any content and (for JSD) cannot get to Confluence.

h3. Environment
Cloud Production

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Given I am a user with no access to a site
# And the site has Jira as the root application
# When a site admin sends me an invitation to their site
# But only gives me access to Confluence
# And I click the link in the email to access the site
# Then I appear to get access to Jira
# But I can't actually see any content
# And if the site has JSD I get a "no portals" page that has no navigation bar so I can't easily get to Confluence

h3. Expected Results
I should either:
* land in the Home application where I can choose an application to which I have access;
* land in a product to which I've been granted access; or
* land on the Permission Violation page with options to choose a different application or go to Home.

If I subsequently try to use any link to something in Jira when I don't have permission, I should get the Permission Violation page.

h3. Actual Results
I land in either:
* Jira Software home unable to view any (non-public) content; or
* Jira Service Desk home with no portals and unable to switch to Confluence.

h3. Notes
This happens because the button in the invitation email always takes me to the root application on the site. If I was only granted access to some other application like Confluence, I land in Jira where I don't have permission to view anything that's not public. JSD appears to pull me over to a page that doesn't let me switch to another application so I'm kind of stuck.

h3. Workaround
I have to add {{/wiki}} to the page URL to get me into Confluence, or {{/home}} to get me into Home.
fields.summary: Confusing login experience for unauthorised users invited to site

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The transition cannot be done due to a condition that is always returning false, even though it was supposed to return true. The condition is the following:

{quote}The field *Test* will have to be equal to value 'ID of the option'. Compared as OptionID.{quote}

+Where the field 'Test' is a Select List (single choice) custom field.+

 !Screen Shot 2017-11-01 at 6.43.59 PM.png|thumbnail! 

It works if the same condition is used but comparing the String instead of OptionID.

h3. Environment

Cloud Jira 1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add this condition to a workflow transition: {quote}The field Test will have to be equal to value '000'. Compared as Option ID.{quote}
# Change the field and fill the field with the option related to the id '000' (so the condition should be true).
# You won't see the transition even though you should be able to
# Remove the condition and you see the transition

h3. Expected Results

To be able to transition the issue since the condition is supposed to return true

h3. Actual Results

Not able to see the transition
 
h3.Workaround

# Compare using 'String' instead of 'OptionID'.
# Use name instead of the ID of the option.
fields.summary: Transition cannot be done due to an OptionID condition related to Select List (single choice) field

h3. Summary

Jira ca850600 using ADG2

When trying to paste the screenshot in the description field or in a comment on an issue using the new UI, the attachment dialog box appears but the upload button seems not to be there.

 !screenshot.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

Browser: Chrome Version 61.0.3163.100

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Access the instance using Chrome in Page zoom 100%.
- Create a test issue.
- Take a screenshot and try to paste it in the Description field.
- A dialog box will appear but the upload button will be hidden.
- If you change the page zoom to 90% or maximize the browser, the box shows up complete, including the upload button.
- Tried to replicate the problem in Firefox and Safari and could see the Upload button normally (in zoom 100%).

h3. Expected Results

The Upload button should appear in the dialog box using page zoom 100% in Chrome.

h3. Actual Results

The Upload button seems to be hidden at the end of the screen.
 
h3.Workaround

Change the page zoom to 90% in Chrome.

When a user logs in to the instance, there is a *Contact Support* option at the bottom if the user wants to make any queries regarding any issues with logging into the instance, this link will bring the user to the [https://support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com/] website to create a ticket, user wants to customize that URL to include the user's own help-desk to gather the information which is bring reported regarding the login page.
h3. *Suggested Solution*

Allow user to edit the URL for Contact Support with a custom URL which redirects to the user's own internal support.
h3. *Sample Picture*

  !support_customer.png|width=888,height=428!
h3. *Why this is important*

With the ability customize the URL, user has the ability to redirect the users to the internal support to categorize and understand the issue and if multiple users record the same login issue, the user on the behalf of others can investigate this issue or create a ticket to Atlassian Support, thus there won't be multiple ticket created on the same issue.

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Filter will return internal error if the JQL condition is no longer valid. Case in point, JIRA version merge breaks filters if existing filter points to a non-existing version (merged).

Null pointer error is shown because the version that the filter is referring to is no longer available.

{noformat}
com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$InitializationException: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference.getInterruptibly(LazyReference.java:149) [atlassian-util-concurrent-2.6.3.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference.get(LazyReference.java:112) [atlassian-util-concurrent-2.6.3.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.context.VersionClauseContextFactory.getAssociatedStringVersion(VersionClauseContextFactory.java:137) [jira-api-1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.context.VersionClauseContextFactory.getAssociatedVersions(VersionClauseContextFactory.java:113) [jira-api-1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.context.VersionClauseContextFactory.getSpecifiedVersion(VersionClauseContextFactory.java:94) [jira-api-1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.context.VersionClauseContextFactory.getContextFromClause(VersionClauseContextFactory.java:152) [jira-api-1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.context.AbstractProjectAttributeClauseContextFactory.getClauseContext(AbstractProjectAttributeClauseContextFactory.java:43) [jira-api-1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.context.QueryContextVisitor.visit(QueryContextVisitor.java:121) [classes/:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.context.QueryContextVisitor.visit(QueryContextVisitor.java:36) [classes/:?]
{noformat}

h3.Expected Result

Filter should still be displayed with no results (or with the usual JQL notice that the condition is invalid). 

h3.Current Result

Filter breaks and error 500 is returned. It is not possible to even edit the JQL due to the error page.

h3.Workaround

Cloud Support can perform this workaround if required. Search for the broken filter on database level.

{noformat}
select * from searchrequest where id = <FILTER_ID>;
{noformat}

Update the 'reqcontent' column to another simple and valid JQL query . 

{noformat}
project = <EXISTING_PROJECT>;
{noformat}

Alternatively, you can also remove the filter from 'Shared Filters'.
fields.summary: Filters return internal error 500 if the JQL condition is no longer valid

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Once you delete a group from the User Management, the groups aren't removed from the roles that they were added to and they still show up in People section for the project.
Once you attempt to remove the group from the role, it fails with the following error message:
{code}
Group 'x' was not found in the system.
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group
# Add the newly created group to a Role in People section of a Project
# Delete the group
# Try to remove the group from the role previously added

h3. Expected Results
1) Once you delete the group, the group should be removed automatically from all the roles that they're added to.
2) Remove the group from the role properly

h3. Actual Results
The groups aren't automatically removed from the roles upon deletion of the groups, and it's not possible to remove them manually in the project roles.
 
h3.Workaround
Recreate these groups using the exact same name, remove them from the project roles and then delete them from the User Management.
fields.summary: Unable to remove deleted groups from project roles

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "Issue detail view" doesn't allow for icons to be added to the "Description" field.  

Available icons in the "Wiki Style Renderer" include:
:):(:P:P:D;);)(y)(n)(i)(/)(/)(x)(!)(+)(-)(?)(on)(off)(*)(*r)(*g)(*g)(*b)(*y)(flag)(flagoff)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the appropriate board
# Select an issue and edit the "Description" field to include an icon - e.g. ":)"

h3. Expected Results
* Icon displayed correctly
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-31 at 2.30.08 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* \:) is displayed instead of ":)"
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-31 at 2.29.20 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* "Wiki Style Renderer" enabled on Field Configuration
* After reproducing the issue, navigate to the issue directly and edit the description field; an escape character has been added to nullify the icon:
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-31 at 2.36.22 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
* Navigate to the issue directly and edit the "Description" field there - i.e. https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/browse/[PKEY]-[ISSUENUM] *OR*
* Navigate to your profile(https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa) and disable "Issue detail view"; this is a per-user setting(each end user will need to make this change themselves)
fields.summary: Issue detail view: unable to add icons to "Description" field

fields.description:
When JIRA issue is viewed on a high resolution screen (I reproduced on a 4K display highest supported resolution) it is centered in the middle. After discussion with the team, it was found that this is by design and there is a maximum width of the entire view issue area (1280px) to ensure readability of information.

However, there should be option for users to display it properly on extra high resolution screens.
fields.summary: On High resolution JIRA screens are centered in the middle of screen

fields.description:
At the moment, any exported Zip file would have the UTC timestamp, instead of the "local" timestamp. 

This could potentially cause conflicts with file syncing and overall documentation, since it clashes with the timestamps of individual files (which utilize the "local" time instead).
fields.summary: Allow for the ability to use local timestamps for zip files

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, as stated in [Delete a Project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/defining-a-project-935391062.html#Definingaproject-Deleteaproject]:
{quote}Deleting a project will only delete the issues, versions, and components associated with the project. It won't delete any of the associated schemes, workflows or issues types, or any content that could be shared with another project.
{quote}
This means after deleting a bulk of projects, Administrator has to go through all the Schemes in JIRA to make sure all the unused Schemes has been removed from the instance.
h3. Suggested Solution

The only reason why the Schemes are being deleted during Project Deletion is that the Schemes could be used by another Project.

*It would be better if we have a verification during Project Deletion to check if the Schemes are being used by any other Projects.*
 * If yes, then just continue the process as it is.
 * *If no, then prompt another dialog to the Administrator to mentioned that these are the Schemes that will be the orphan Schemes after Project Deletion and would the Administrator wants to delete the Schemes during the Project Deletion.*

It also will be good if JRACLOUD-64878 get implemented, which will reduce an Administrator job to clean JIRA data. Or allow Administrator to bulk delete schemes as per JRACLOUD-41977.
fields.summary: Deleting a project should delete the schemes if they are unused

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Activity Stream Gadget is ignoring the existing filters after a bulk operation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have an Activity Stream gadget on a dashboard.
# Configure it to filter only the activity from comments:
!comment-added-filter.png|thumbnail! 
# Bulk edit 10+ issues with any action than a comment, for instance - add a label on these issues.

h3. Expected Results
The Activity Stream gadget is still showing the most recently commented issues in the stream.

h3. Actual Results
The Activity Stream gadget will show these recently edited issues first, instead of the commented ones.
 
h3. Notes
In certain cases, the Activity Stream gadget start showing the most recently commented issues again in the stream after a few hours, but this behavior is not consistent.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: The Activity Stream Gadget is ignoring the existing filters after a bulk operation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When hitting the endpoint {{/rest/api/2/search}} via GET request, the parameters {{startAt}} and {{maxResults}} are ignored.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# For the purpose of this test, I've used my own SP project, which has 2 issues:
{code}curl -D- -u <email_address> -H "Content-type: application/json" -d '{"startAt": 1, "maxResults": 2}' -X GET https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/search?jql=project="SP"{code}
# The output of the above was:
{code}{"expand":"schema,names","startAt":0,"maxResults":50,"total":2,"issues"{code}

h3. Expected Results
The parameter should not be ignored.

h3. Actual Results
Parameters are ignored and startAt is set to 0 and maxResults defaults to 50.

h3. Workaround
Use POST instead:
{code}curl -D- -u <email_address> -H "Content-type: application/json" -d '{"startAt": 1, "maxResults": 2}' -X POST https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/search?jql=project="SP"{code}
{code}{"expand":"names,schema","startAt":1,"maxResults":2,"total":2,"issues"{code}
fields.summary: startAt and maxResults parameters are not taking effect when GETting from /rest/api/2/search

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Whenever a user does not have access to JIRA Software or Core, and they are mentioned on an issue, they do not receive notifications for that issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user without any application access
 # Create a notification scheme that includes this user (we tested by allowing browse projects permission and notification through a user custom field and also through watchers field)
 # Add user to that issue as a watcher or using a custom field
 # Make sure the user has browse permission access to that issue
 # Try to generate notification
 # No Notification is sent, neither information is thrown on outgoing mail log

h3. Expected Results

The users who are mentioned on a JIRA issue but have no application access should receive notifications on the issues they are mentioned in.
h3. Actual Results

They receive no notifications at all
fields.summary: Unlicensed JIRA users can be mentioned but do not received emails

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Not able to transition tickets assigned to inactive user whose username was changed in the past

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a screen called 'Reopen & Close Screen' and add 'Assignee' field to it.
# Setup a workflow transition which uses the screen created in step 1 & have a condition on permissions to execute that transitions. e.g., below is the 'Closed' transition config which uses 'Reopen & Close Screen' and a condition.
 !Closed.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a user (e.g. _testuser_)
# Create a ticket in JIRA which is using the workflow mentioned in Step 2.
# Assign the JIRA ticket to user created in Step 3.
# Go to user management and change the user name to _'test_user'_.
# Deactivate the user.
# Go to JIRA ticket created in step 4, and try to execute the transition mentioned in step 2.

h3. Expected Results
Transition should work without any error.

h3. Actual Results
Transition fails with below error
{noformat}
User 'test_user' cannot be assigned issues.
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Revert the username (i.e., _testuser_ in this case) of the inactive user so that the transition works fine.
fields.summary: Not able to transition tickets assigned to inactive user whose username was changed in the past

fields.description:
When a user attaches a file to an issue, and then another with the same filename the filenames are changed to include additional characters at the end.

This used to gray out the old file and allow the new attachment.  This is needed for version control.
fields.summary: Attachments with the same filename add characters at the end of the name.

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
As per [Managing your user profile|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/managing-your-user-profile-764478256.html], when Gravatar has been disabled, user should be able to choose an avatar from the pre-packaged or default user avatars to set as the profile picture. But the default avatars are no longer available and the only options available are "Upload an image" and "Take a photo".

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Set *Allow Gravatars* as *OFF* in "General Configurations"
# Click on *Profile*
# Click on profile photo ([direct link|https://id.atlassian.com/profile/profile.action?application=jira&mode=cloud&continue=https://mars-test.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa#edit-avatar])

h3. Expected Results:
* Able to choose an avatar from a set of pre-packaged avatars
* Upload an image
* Take a photo

h3. Actual Results:
* Upload an image
* Take a photo

h3. Workaround:
Download the user avatars from this link  [^user-avatars.zip]  and upload them manually (using "Upload an image").
fields.summary: User pre-packaged/default avatars are no longer available

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Unable to embed resource" message for new attachment which is not an image

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to issue 
# Add an attachment (a *.docx* file) to issue using:
#*  the *browse* functionality, OR
#**  !browse.png|thumbnail!  
#* Drag and drop functionality to *Attachments section*
#**  !Attachments section.png|thumbnail!  
# Add the link to the attachment in a comment using 
#*  !Attachment button.png|thumbnail!   

h3. Expected Results
The expected format for links is shown and the link is embedded. As explained in [Formatting links|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=links] the link should be in the following format:
{code}
[^attachment.ext]
{code}


h3. Actual Results
The format for adding the file is automatically chosen as for the image one:
{code}
 !test.docx|thumbnail!  
{code}

which results in error message:
{code}
Unable to embed resource: test.docx of type application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document
{code}

 
h3. Notes
The issue is only affecting new attachments. After few minutes it is possible to add the correct link.

h3.Workaround
# Click to add a comment on the issue
# Drag and drop the file in the *Comment section* 
* !Drag and drop to comment section.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Unable to embed resource" message for new attachment different then image

fields.description:
h3. Summary

This bug is affecting default mail server that is used in JIRA (i.e. jira@xxxxx.atlassian.net). If the mail server is jira@xxxxx.atlassian.net and the user tried to send mail to Jira@xxxxx.atlassian.net (note the capital J), it will not work. The mail server is case sensitive.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Incoming Mail page
# Take note of the default POP / IMAP Mail Server
# Create a Mail Handler
# Send an e-mail to the default POP / IMAP Mail Server, but change the e-mail to uppercase

h3. Expected Results
Issue can be created successfully

h3. Actual Results
There will not be any issue created
fields.summary: Default mail server in incoming mail is case sensitive

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
A feature does not exist that allows users to automatically copy their worklog descriptions(time tracking provided by Jira) to comments.  There are third-party add-ons that provide this functionality for Jira Server, but there aren't any options for Cloud.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow Jira admins to set the worklog editor to automatically create a comment on the issue time which work is being logged.
* End users can choose to turn this feature off.

h3. Why this is important
* Users should have the option to have their worklog descriptions automatically copied and posted as an issue comment because users are manually copying/pasting the worklog descriptions as more often than not - the description and issue comment carry the same content.
 
h3. Workaround 
* Migrate to Jira Server.
fields.summary: Copy/insert worklog descriptions into issue comments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When using a large amount of workflow transitions it becomes difficult to quickly identify a transition from the list, a preferred order might be utilised by adding the opsbar-sequence to the workflow properties.

While this works for the view issue screen the configured order is not respected on a board when navigating via the (...) button on the sidebar quickview > more actions.  

h3. Suggested Solution

Respect the workflow properties and enforce the configured order on every screen.
fields.summary: The action button, more actions option should respect opsbar-sequence workflow option for determining the order of the Workflow transition.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the feature *Jira Core Labs* is set based on user profile

h3. Suggested Solution
There should be an option for *Jira Core Labs* to be turned off entirely for all user in the instance

h3. Why this is important
It would be good to have this feature so that Administrator of the instance have the ability to control the feature and ensure every user has the same configurations
fields.summary: Ability to set Jira Core Labs for all users in the instance

fields.description:
It would be great to have a custom field type on JIRA that works with the following logic:
 * Its value should be the same for all issues added with it
 * Every time a user updates the field on an issue, the new value must be updated to all issues in a real-time
fields.summary: Create Custom field with single value for all issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Creating a ticket via REST API, setting a 'Text Field (read only)' and then editing the issue in UI, prevents it from being found in searches using that Text Field with the value set.

This apparently only happens to 'read only' fields, as it was tested with regular 'Text Field (single line)' without showing this problem
'
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a  'Text Field (read only)'  and make sure it's part of a project's create and view screens
# Create an issue via REST setting a value to the field. Example:=
{code}
curl -X POST -d '{ "fields": { "summary": "Test", "project": { "id": "10000" }, "issuetype": { "id": "10100" } ,"customfield_10230":"My Test" } } ' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/api/latest/issue
{code}
# (First search) search fro the custom field using JQL: {{cf[10230] ~ 'My Test'}}
# Edit the issue (tested with Due Date, Priority and Summary, but should happen to any field) - *Click edit, instead of using inline edit*
# (Second search) search fro the custom field using JQL: {{cf[10230] ~ 'My Test'}}

h3. Expected Results
Both first and second search find the issue.

h3. Actual Results
Only first search finds the issue, not second.
 
h3. Notes
The generated tokens for that issue are removed, so it cannot be found.

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Setting read only field via REST on creation and editing issue prevents search

fields.description:
When using the [Jira Cloud for Slack (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.slack/cloud/overview] integration, I'd like to have a page available where I could see *all* notifications that are currently set up between channels and projects (DM notifications aren't needed). 

Currently, there are two methods to check which notifications are set: 
{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#000000|titleBGColor=#99b3ff|bgColor=#e0e0eb}
h5. From the Slack end

By typing {{/jira}} inside any channel and clicking on the link *Manage Subscriptions*. A new screen will show up where all projects linked with the Channel (where the command was run) will be displayed.

h5. From JIRA Project Settings page

By accessing the *Slack Integration* link available on a JIRA Project page: 

 !Slack_project settings.png|thumbnail! 

{panel}
Accessing the integration page from the Slack end (first method) will list all projects currently connected to that channel. On the other hand, accessing the JIRA Project Settings page (second method) will show all channels currently connected with the project. On both methods, the only way to check which notifications are set up is by clicking on the *edit link* on each project > channel connection. 

 !edit_notifications.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA For Slack integration: Please provide a page (available to admins only) that shows all the notifications currently setup on the integration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Currently, Webhooks requests are send based on the language of the user profile. 

h3. Suggested Resolution

Have an option to choose the language for the webhook requests, so that it is standardized.
fields.summary: Have a feature to choose the language of the webhook requests

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Tooltip of Parent for Subtask is showing outside of screen while hovering on it
 !Hover.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create task1
 2. Create subtask1 to task1
 3. Navigate to subtask1 and hover over the link to the parent task1 in the header
h3. Expected Results

The tooltip should take the edge of the screen into consideration and open downwards in this case. The tooltip should also be cleared when navigating away from the page
h3. Actual Results

The tooltip will not take the edge of the screen into consideration and will get cut. The tooltip will also stick on the page after navigating away and it will not be possible to close it without manually refreshing the page.
h3. Workaround

Switch back to old Jira look

!Hover-2.png|thumbnail!

!Hover-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Tooltip of Parent for Subtask is showing outside of screen on Jira new experience

fields.description:
It seems that the new JIRA interface ADG3 does not have a way to reach the summary page of Software projects, only by typing directly in the URL. e.g: [https://pettertest.atlassian.net/projects/TP/summary|https://23g-rotterdam.atlassian.net/projects/TRVL/summary/] 

 

In the old interface (ADG2), this page was displayed when you click on the project title. Could you please implement it back?

!Screen Shot 2017-10-26 at 10.50.23.png!
fields.summary: Can not reach the Project Summary page in the New JIRA interface

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Issue Details View in JIRA Core Board is showing empty pop up without any information.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open JIRA Core board
 # Click on of the issues

h3. Actual Result

Issue details view is showing empty pop up.
h3. Expected Result

Issue details view is showing the data correctly.
h3. Workaround

Disable JIRA Core Labs by navigating to:
 - https://<instance URL>/secure/admin/AdminLabs.jspa

If disabling the Lab features on the Administration panel did not solve this issue, you can disable it following the steps below:

# Click on your avatar, at the top-right of the screen then click *Profile*
# Under *Labs*, disable *Issue detail view*

 

Please subscribe to the following status page [https://status.atlassian.com/incidents/07hsfsp58q2s] for further updates on the status of the incident.
fields.summary: Unable to load issue in Issue Details View

fields.description:
h2. Summary 
After importing into JIRA Cloud, the list of inactive users is different from the source instance. 

h2. Steps to Replicate 
# Import into a JIRA Cloud instance. 
# Compare the list of inactive users with the source instance. 

h2. Expected Result 
Both instances, source and target, should have the same list of inactive users. 

h2. Current Result 
The target instance has a different list of inactive users, and these users are marked as it is without any specific pattern.
fields.summary: Importing into JIRA Cloud will mark users as inactive randomly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Deleted projects still appearing under 'Recent' in App Switcher

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project
# View some pages on it
# Delete the project
# Go to App Switcher

h3. Expected Results
Under 'Recent', only recently accessed and existing projects should appear.

h3. Actual Results
Under 'Recent', recently accessed but no longer existing projects still appear.

h3. Notes
* If you click the deleted project, a message will appear: "This project isn't available"
* Similar to Confluence spaces - https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-57228
fields.summary: Deleted Projects still appearing under 'Recent' in App Switcher

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Imported issues contain no Rank.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import any set of issues through CSV or using another issues' import tool.

h3. Expected Results

The issues should have a rank entry once they're created.

h3. Actual Results

The issues are created without a rank which may lead to other errors on the ranking system.
 
h3. Notes

Running a rebalance of the rank won't fix the problem and the integrity check of the lexo rank won't find the current problems.
This causes the following bug if the issues imported are sub-tasks:
-  [Transitioning sub-tasks without rank on boards duplicates them JRACLOUD-67856|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67856]

h3.Workaround

*Note:* Do NOT view the issues in Backlog yet after the import process, as that may incorrectly ranked the issues.

Use the following JQL to find the affected issues:
{code}
rank = null
{code}

*For the workaround to take effect you must select the Rank field as one of the displayed columns*.
Simply by loading the issues through the search issue page should create their rank, to confirm this a reload of the page shouldn't return the same issues that were loaded before(This will only help in case you haven't transitioned the sub-tasks yet).

For cases where this doesn't work contact Atlassian support.
fields.summary: Imported issues don't have a rank entry
As a mobile user, I want to see the assigned issues grouped by status instead of status category

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you create an issue and in the create issue screen you set the assignee to a user and this user has spaces in the username, the JQL _assignee was "user"_ will not retrieve the issue. It will only show if the assignee is changed to someone else and then changed back to that user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user and set spaces between his name like "test user"
# Create an issue and in the create issue screen set the assignee to the newly created user ("test user")
# create a JQL like below:
{code}
assignee was "test user"
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The issue should be retrieved through that filter

h3. Actual Results
The issue is not shown in the filter
 
h3.Workaround
If you change the assignee to someone else and then change it back to that user, the filter will retrieve the issue.
fields.summary: JQL 'assignee 'was' "user"' doesn't work properly if the user has or had spaces in the username.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently when viewing an issue in the Business Projects the new Jira Issue view pop-up window loading time is about 2 seconds and shows a blank issue window
*  !Issue details view Bussiness Projects.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the new Jira Issue view pop-up window loading time
 
h3. Workaround 
The *Board issue details* is currently in Jira Core labs and can be disabled. 
*  !Disable JIRA Core labs.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve the new Jira Issue view pop-up window loading time

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The issue link search is not working if you search in uppercase.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with a summary in uppercase - i.e - *TEST*
# Go to another issue and try to search the issue looking for its summary (TEST)

h3. Expected Results
The issue appears in the search bar to be linked.

h3. Actual Results
No issue can be found.
!link-not-found.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
- Regardless the issue summary is in uppercase or not, the search does not return any results, if your search is in uppercase.
- Checking the {{jiraissuetokens}} table, you can see the tokens are in lowercase.
For instance, here's the entry for the entry for the TEST issue created earlier:
{code}SELECT * FROM jiraissuetokens WHERE field='summary' and issueid = 10050{code}
|| issueid|| field|| tokens|| 
| 10050 | summary| 'test'| 
- If you search for the summary in lowercase, the issue can be found:
!link-working.png|thumbnail! 
- Alternatively, searching for the issue key return show results as well:
!link-key.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Search for the issue summary in lowercase, or alternatively, search for its issue key.
fields.summary: Issue link search does not work as expected if the search is in uppercase

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Attach Screenshot" pop-up window is not scrollable when using the zoom in feature in Google Chrome browser

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Zoom in in the browser (*cmd* + *+*)
# Create screenshoot  (*cmd* + *Shift* + *4*)
# Open an issue
# Paste the screenshot in a comment  (*cmd* + *v*)

h3. Expected Results
It is possible to scroll down the pop up window so the *Upload* button is visible. 
*  !Visible Upload button.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
It is *not* possible to scroll down the pop up window and the *Upload* button is not visible. 
 *  !Not Visible upload button.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
Zoom out the browser window
fields.summary: "Attach Screenshot" pop-up window is not scrollable when using the zoom-in feature in Google Chrome browser

fields.description:
As of this moment, the search field in the main Help Center is set to English, regardless of the language setting in the user's search profile. 

Right now, it is set to: "Find help articles and forms"

If this search bar would be able to utilize the language setting of the profile, it can potentially prevent a lot of confusion.
fields.summary: Allow Help Center search bar to respect Profile Language settings

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The release date in Jira Road Map gadget is off by one day

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a project, and create a new release:
!new-release.png|thumbnail! 
# Set up a dashboard and add the *Jira Road Map* gadget

h3. Expected Results
The Release date should be the same on both screens

h3. Actual Results
The due date is off by one day, as depicted below:
!dashboard-gadget.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
- The *Version 2.0* depicted in both images is a release generated automatically when you create a sample project in Jira, that's why the release date is correctly displayed.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: The release date in Jira Road Map gadget is off by one day

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Text Formatting Notation Help does not indicate a way to create a new paragraph in the new Jira UI

h3. Environment
In Jira Cloud, using the new Jira interface

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In new Jira UI, edit an issue description
# Enter some text
# press Enter twice (once to start a new line, and once more to leave an empty line between blocks)
# enter some more text
# Save changes

h3. Expected Results
Would expect a single empty line between bodies of text to create a new paragraph


h3. Actual Results
There is a line break, but this does not look visible different then a wrap around line of text.

A paragraph should have more spacing between itself and the previous paragraph


h3. Notes
https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=breaks

Still indicates that a single empty line should be sufficient.


h3.Workaround
It appears possible to do this if you leave 3 empty lines between blocks of text.  I also found you could hold Shift while you press Enter twice in order to achieve this same view.  However only pressing enter twice leaves 2 spaces without a proper paragraph display.
fields.summary: Text Formatting Notation Help does not indicate a way to create a new paragraph in the new Jira UI
